item.title: Denver's Chicano Movement Legacy ProjectWillie N Rodriguez is with Sylina Mustang Garcia and Arturo Rodriguez in Denver, Colorado.It is...
item.content:encoded:
Denver's Chicano Movement Legacy ProjectWillie N Rodriguez is with Sylina Mustang Garcia and Arturo Rodriguez in Denver, Colorado.

It is always an honor to sit down and speak to the Elders of the Chicano Movement. We appreciate the advice and encouragement, Bones, see you soon, Carnal.

#CrusadeForJustice
item.author: Denver's Chicano Movement Legacy Project

item.title: Chicano artist in Denver
item.content:encoded:
Denver's Chicano Movement Legacy Project

Chicano artist in Denver

Jerry Jaramillo is at La Familia Recreation Center. ¬∑ Denver

I‚Äôm so sorry for your loss,Arlette Lucero, Paul & Joshua. Steve was my neighbor for 7 years in North Denver. We talked art with Ernie Gallegos daily. Together w...ith Carlos Sandoval & Al Sanchez, we formed CHAC & created murals that showed the world what Chicanos could do if given the opportunity to shine. You are my brother, the world will miss you. Through your art, you will live forever.

‚ÄúLa Familia C√≥smica‚Äù
By: Jerry Jaramillo, Stevon Lucero, Carlos Sandoval & Al Sanchez
At: La Familia Rec Center
65 S. Elati Denver, CO
1980

See more

item.content:encoded:

Viva Corky

Rodolfo 'Corky' Gonzales was also an educator, boxer and poet who founded the nation's first private school with a focus on Chicano and Mexican-American cult...

item.title: Chicano power
item.content:encoded:
Denver's Chicano Movement Legacy Project

Chicano power

After decades of advocacy, the park officially received its name change to La Raza Park in the Sunnyside neighborhood. But the advocacy doesn‚Äôt stop there.

9news.com

The past, present & future of La Raza Park

After decades of advocacy, the park officially received its name change to La Raza Park in the Sunnyside neighborhood.
